[[Image:Ground Bee.png|thumb|''Ground Bee'' portrayed in ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing|MERP]]'']]

In [[Middle-earth]], '''bees''' were buzzing domestic insects kept for their ability to make honey. Particularly famous were those of [[Beorn]], which reached an enormous size.<ref>{{H|7}}</ref> The fine [[The Shire|Shire]] weather of summer and autumn in {{TA|3018}} was such that "honey was dripping in the combs".<ref>{{FR|I3}}</ref>

In [[Qenya]], the word for "honey bee" is ''nier'' (''nies''-), and "a bee" is ''nion'' or ''nier''. The [[Gnomish]] word for "a bee" is ''nios'' or ''nio'' (''niwin'' is "a female bee", and ''niosturwin'' means "queen bee").<ref>{{PE|12}}, p. 65</ref><ref>{{PE|11}}, p. 60</ref>

== Portrayal in adaptations ==
'''1982-97: ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing]]'':'''
:Ground Bees, producers of honey, are relatives of the yellow jackets and true bees. Due to their large numbers, the Ground Bees pose a threat to characters.<ref>{{ICE|2012}}, p. 36</ref>

'''2022: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]'':'''
:In the [[Adar (episode)|third episode]] of the first season, it is revealed during [[Sadoc Burrows|Sadoc Burrows's]] speech of remembrance that one Harfoot, [[Blovo Bolgerbuck]], was lost during a previous migration due to bees. The other Harfoots loved him, but considered him to be an ijit.
